title: Fuel Filter - Renew

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Note the orientation of the hose bracket and all hose retaining clips for installation.
Release the fixing and remove the hose bracket from the fuel pump bracket.

body.name: Fuel pump assy hose bracket B00132

body.body: Prior to removing the filter, note the direction of the arrow on the side of the filter. The arrow should point away from the fuel pump, towards the pressure regulator.
Remove and discard the two fuel filter cable ties.
Release clip securing the fuel hose to fuel outlet pipe.
Release the two fuel hose clips from either side of the fuel filter.
Detach the fuel hose from the fuel outlet pipe.
Remove the fuel filter from the fuel pump assembly.
Note the position and orientation of the dot alignment mark on the fuel filter outlet hose for installation.
Remove the fuel hose from the outlet of the fuel filter.
Inspect all hoses for cracks, splits, fraying and other damage. Replace as necessary.
Check all hose clamps for cracks and signs of distortion. Replace as necessary.
Check the mesh filter for damage and replace if necessary.
Install the fuel filter to the hose from the fuel pump, ensuring the arrow on the filter points away from the pump.
Fit the fuel hose to the outlet of the fuel filter, make sure the dot alignment mark is positioned as noted for removal.
Attach the fuel filter hose to the fuel outlet pipe.
Secure the two filter hoses with the three hose clips, make sure the orientation of the clips are as noted for removal.
Secure the fuel filter to the fuel pump bracket with two cable ties.
Fit the hose bracket to the fuel pump bracket as noted for removal and tighten its fixing to

body.name: Fuel pump assy hose bracket B00132

search: Fuel Filter - Renew
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Removal
Perform the following operations:
Fuel Pump Assembly - Removal
Note the orientation of the hose bracket and all hose retaining clips for installation.
Release the fixing and remove the hose bracket from the fuel pump bracket.
Fixing
Hose bracket
Prior to removing the filter, note the direction of the arrow on the side of the filter. The arrow should point away from the fuel pump, towards the pressure regulator.
Remove and discard the two fuel filter cable ties.
Release clip securing the fuel hose to fuel outlet pipe.
Release the two fuel hose clips from either side of the fuel filter.
Detach the fuel hose from the fuel outlet pipe.
Cable ties
Hose clip (fuel outlet pipe)
Hose clips (fuel filter)
Remove the fuel filter from the fuel pump assembly.
Note the position and orientation of the dot alignment mark on the fuel filter outlet hose for installation.
Remove the fuel hose from the outlet of the fuel filter.
Dot alignment mark
Fuel outlet pipe
Inspection
Inspect all hoses for cracks, splits, fraying and other damage. Replace as necessary.
Check all hose clamps for cracks and signs of distortion. Replace as necessary.
Check the mesh filter for damage and replace if necessary.
Installation
Install the fuel filter to the hose from the fuel pump, ensuring the arrow on the filter points away from the pump.
Fit the fuel hose to the outlet of the fuel filter, make sure the dot alignment mark is positioned as noted for removal.
Attach the fuel filter hose to the fuel outlet pipe.
Secure the two filter hoses with the three hose clips, make sure the orientation of the clips are as noted for removal.
Secure the fuel filter to the fuel pump bracket with two cable ties.
Cable ties
Hose clip (fuel outlet pipe)
Hose clips (fuel filter)
Fit the hose bracket to the fuel pump bracket as noted for removal and tighten its fixing to
4 Nm
Fixing
Hose bracket
